QAPair.Question: What is (are) Weight-loss surgery and children ?
QAPair.Answer: Obesity in children and teens is a serious health problem. About 1 in 6 children in the United States are affected by obesity. A child who is overweight or has obesity is more likely to be overweight or have obesity as an adult. Children with obesity have health problems that used to be seen only in adults. When these problems begin in childhood, they often become worse in adulthood. A child who is overweight or has obesity is also more likely to have problems such as: Low self-esteem, Poor grades in school, Depression ,
